Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "...At any rate, we'll lock this room and leave everything as it is until the police come. ...No objections, I take it?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......At any rate, we'll lock this room and leave everything as it is until the police come. ......All agreed?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......At any rate, we'll lock this room and leave everything as it is until the police come. ......Any problems?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……とにかく、この部屋は警察が来るまでこのままにして施錠します。……いいですね？」
Russian (RU): "......Так или иначе, мы запрём эту комнату и оставим всё как есть, пока не прибудет полиция. ......Есть возражения?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......De qualquer forma, vamos manter esse quarto fechado até que a polícia chegue. ......Todos concordam?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……總之，這房間在警察來之前就這麼保持原樣鎖上了。……沒有問題吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……总之，这房间在警察来之前就这么保持原样锁上了。……没有问题吧？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... In ogni caso, finché non arriva la polizia, chiuderemo questa stanza e lasceremo tutto così com'è. ... Non ci sarà alcun problema così, giusto?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Ad ogni modo, chiuderemo questa stanza fino all'arrivo della polizia, e lasceremo tutto così com'è... Chiaro?"
Turkish (TR): "......Her halükarda, bu odayı kilitleyeceğiz ve polis gelene kadar her şeyi olduğu gibi bırakacağız. ......Herkes kabul ediyor mu?"

Steam (ST): Natsuhi announced it as though she didn't care whether they agreed or not.
Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi proclaimed it as though she didn't care whether they agreed or not.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi proclaimed it as though she didn't care whether we agreed or not.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃が全員に、有無を言わせない口調でそう宣言する。
Russian (RU): Нацухи заявила это так, будто ей было всё равно, согласны мы или нет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi perguntou isso, mesmo sem mesmo se importar se os outros concordariam ou não.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃以不容辯駁的語調說道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃以不容辩驳的语调说道。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Natsuhi lo affermò come se non le importasse se fossimo stati d'accordo o no.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Affermò Natsuhi, con un tono che non ammetteva repliche...
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi sanki kabul edip etmemeleri umurunda değilmiş gibi bunu dile getirdi.

Steam (ST): ...If anyone had a right to object, it would've been George, ...but he looked as though he'd shed enough tears.
Umineko Project (UP): ...If anyone had a right to object, it would have been George, ...but he looked as though he had shed enough tears.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …反論する者がもしもいるとすれば、それは譲治だったが、…譲治ももう充分に涙を流したのだろう。
Russian (RU): ...Если кто и имел право возразить, то это был Джордж. Но он выглядел так, словно пролил уже достаточно слёз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Se alguém tivesse o direito de se opor a ela, esse alguém teria sido George, ...mas ele parecia já ter derramado lágrimas o bastante por aquele dia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …如果說還有誰可能會反對，那肯定是讓治了，…不過讓治的眼淚也已經流乾了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …如果说还有谁可能会反对，那肯定是让治了，…不过让治的眼泪也已经流干了吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Se ci fosse stato qualcuno con un'obiezione, sarebbe stato George... ma sembrava che avesse pianto abbastanza lacrime.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Se ci fosse stato qualcuno in grado di obiettare, quello era George... ma anche lui sembrava aver pianto a sufficienza.
Turkish (TR): ...İtiraz etmeye hakkı olan biri varsa o da George'du, ...ama yeterince gözyaşı dökmüş gibi görünüyordu.

Steam (ST): George nodded slightly, still facing away from the others, and when he stood up, everyone else agreed too.
Umineko Project (UP): Still facing away from them, George nodded slightly and rose to his feet, and everyone else agreed in response.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): George nodded slightly, still facing away from us, and when he stood up, everyone else agreed too.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治が背中を向けたまま小さく頷き、立ち上がると、それで他の全員も同意した。
Russian (RU): Не поворачиваясь к нам, Джордж слегка кивнул и поднялся на ноги. Все остальные согласились.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ainda sem olhar diretamente para todos, George assentiu levemente e ficou de pé, e todos ali, em resposta, também concordaram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他背對著大家輕輕點了點頭，站了起來，如此一來其他人也一致同意了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他背对着大家轻轻点了点头，站了起来，如此一来其他人也一致同意了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): George annuì debolmente, dandoci ancora le spalle, e quando si alzò in piedi, anche tutti gli altri acconsentirono.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): [=ITA]
Turkish (TR): Yüzü hâlâ onlara dönük olan George hafifçe başıyla onaylayıp ayağa kalktı ve diğer herkes de aynı şekilde karşılık verdi.

Steam (ST): Natsuhi still hadn't opened that Western envelope of the Family Head that she'd picked up. ...But now that they'd decided to leave this room, she decided to unseal it in the parlor, where everyone could watch.
Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi still hadn't opened the head's Western‐style envelope she had picked up.{n}...But since they would all be leaving the room now, she decided that she would unseal it in the parlor, where everyone could watch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The letter in the head's western-style envelope that Natsuhi had picked up still hadn't been opened....But now that we had decided to leave this room, she had decided to unseal it in the parlor, where everyone could watch.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃は拾った当主の洋形封筒をまだ開けていなかった。…だが、話の流れから、この部屋を出ることになってしまったので、開封は客間でみんなの前で行うことにした。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 夏妃は拾った当主の洋形封筒をまだ開けていなかった。{n}…だが、話の流れから、この部屋を出ることになってしまったので、開封は客間でみんなの前で行うことにした。
Russian (RU): Нацухи до сих пор не вскрыла поднятый ей конверт, который принадлежал главе семьи.{n}...Но раз уж мы все сейчас покинем эту комнату, она решила вскрыть его в гостиной на всеобщее обозрение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi ainda não havia aberto o envelope em estilo ocidental do chefe da família que ela havia pego.{n}...Mas já que todos estariam deixando o local agora, ela decidiu que ela própria desselaria o envelope quando chegassem na sala de visitas, onde todos pudessem ver.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃還沒有打開撿到的那個當主所有的西式信封。{n}…但從談話中可以聽出，由於大家已經決定要離開房間，所以信也要回客廳當著大家的面打開。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃还没有打开捡到的那个当主所有的西式信封。{n}…但从谈话中可以听出，由于大家已经决定要离开房间，所以信也要回客厅当着大家的面打开。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La lettera nella busta in stile occidentale del capofamiglia che Natsuhi aveva raccolto non era stata ancora aperta. ... Ma dal momento che avevamo deciso di lasciare questa stanza, decise di aprirla nel salotto, dove tutti avrebbero potuto vedere.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La lettera nella busta in stile occidentale del capofamiglia, che Natsuhi aveva raccolto, non era stata ancora aperta... Ma dalla piega presa dalla conversazione, era stato deciso di lasciare quella stanza, per cui decise di aprirla in salotto davanti a tutti.
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi eline aldığı Batı tarzı zarfı hâlâ açmamıştı.{n}...Ama şimdi hepsi odadan çıkacağı için zarfı salonda, herkesin görebileceği bir yerde açmaya karar verdi.

Steam (ST): As soon as they walked out into the hallway to head back to the parlor, ......some of them immediately felt something out of place, ...or maybe sensed something strange.
Umineko Project (UP): As soon as they walked out into the hallway to head back to the parlor, .........some of them immediately felt something out of place, ...or maybe sensed something strange.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As soon as we walked out into the hallway to head back to the parlor, .........some of us immediately felt something out of place, ...or maybe sensed something strange.
PC Japanese (JP): そして客間へ戻ろうと廊下を歩き出すと、………すぐに違和感、…あるいは異常に気付く者が現れた。
Russian (RU): Как только мы вышли в коридор, чтобы вернуться в гостиную... Некоторые из нас сразу почувствовали, что что‐то было не так. А, может быть, просто ощутили что‐то странное.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim que todos caminharam para o corredor para se dirigirem à sala de visitas, .........alguns imediatamente começaram a sentir como se algo estivesse diferente, ...ou talvez sentiram algo, de fato, estranho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 隨後，就在大家走在回客廳的走廊上時，………馬上就有人察覺到了不對勁，…或者說，異常。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 随后，就在大家走在回客厅的走廊上时，………马上就有人察觉到了不对劲，…或者说，异常。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nel momento in cui mettemmo piede nel corridoio per dirigerci nuovamente nel salotto... alcuni di noi sentirono immediatamente che qualcosa era fuori luogo, o forse si accorsero di qualcosa di strano.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E nel momento in cui misimo piede nel corridoio, per tornare nel salotto... alcuni sentirono subito che qualcosa fosse fuori posto... o forse avevano percepito qualche anomalia.
Turkish (TR): Salona geri dönmek üzere koridora çıkar çıkmaz, .........bazıları hemen bir şeylerin yolunda olmadığını hissetti, ...ya da belki de garip bir şeyler sezdi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Uuh... Una puzza?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): "Ah, ...did you notice it too, Maria? ...Seriously, what's that smell? ...It's awful..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Ah, ...you notice it too, Maria? ...What is this stench... It smells awful..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Ah, ...did you notice it too, Maria? ...What is this stench, ...it smells awful..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あ、…真里亞もわかるか？…こりゃ何の臭いだよ、…酷ぇ臭いだぜ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あ、…真里亞もわかるか？　…こりゃ何の臭いだよ、…酷ぇ臭いだぜ…」
Russian (RU): "А... Ты тоже обратила внимание, Мария? ...Что это за вонь? Пахнет отвратительно..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ah, ...você também sentiu, Maria? ...O que é esse fedor... Que cheiro horrível..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊，…真里亞也聞到了嗎？…這到底是什麼味道啊？…好濃的臭味嘞…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊，…真里亚也闻到了吗？…这到底是什么味道啊？…好浓的臭味嘞…」

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Ah... l'hai notata anche tu, Maria...? Cos'è questo fetore... Che odoraccio..."
Turkish (TR): "Ah, ...Maria, sen de mi fark ettin? ...Bu pis koku da ne...? Berbat kokuyor..."

Steam (ST): When everyone sniffed the air, ...they did notice a horrible burnt smell drifting through the hallway, one that none of them had smelled until then.
Umineko Project (UP): As they all sniffed the air, ...they did notice a horribly foul burnt smell, unlike anything any of them had ever smelled before, drifting through the hallway.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When everyone sniffed the air, ...they did notice a horrible burnt smell drifting through the hallway, one that none of us had smelled until then.
PC Japanese (JP): 皆、鼻をくんくん鳴らせると、…確かに、これまで嗅いだことのない、焦げたような酷い悪臭が廊下を漂ってくるのを感じた。
Russian (RU): Принюхавшись, они заметили ужасный запах гари, не похожий ни на что из того, что им доводилось ощущать, который распространялся по коридору.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): À medida que todos farejavam o ar, ...eles logo perceberam um horrível cheiro de queimado, diferente de qualquer coisa que eles já haviam sentido antes, empestando o corredor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大家都用鼻子聞了起來，…確實，走廊上飄著一股濃烈的惡臭，像是什麼燒焦了似的，之前並沒有聞到過。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大家都用鼻子闻了起来，…确实，走廊上飘着一股浓烈的恶臭，像是什么烧焦了似的，之前并没有闻到过。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando tutti annusarono l'aria... c'era veramente un orribile odore di bruciato che aleggiava per il corridoio che nessuno di noi aveva notato prima.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando tutti fiutarono l'aria... effettivamente sentirono aleggiare lungo il corridoio il peggior tanfo di bruciato che avessero mai odorato.
Turkish (TR): Hepsi havayı kokladığında, ...koridorda daha önce kimsenin kokusunu almadığı, korkunç derecede kötü bir yanık kokusunun yayıldığını fark ettiler.

Speaker: Kumasawa Chiyo
Steam (ST): "...I will go quickly to check the kitchen... I'm sure I turned the flame off..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I will go quickly to check the kitchen... I'm sure I turned the flame off......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……私、ちょっと厨房を見てきます…。火はちゃんと消したはずなんですよ……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……私、ちょっと厨房を見てきます…。火はちゃんと消したはずなんですよ……」
Russian (RU): "......Сейчас же пойду проверю кухню... Я же точно выключала огонь..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu vou ir checar a cozinha... Tenho certeza que eu apaguei o fogão......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……我去廚房看看…。火應該關掉了呀……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……我去厨房看看…。火应该关掉了呀……」

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Vado a controllare un attimo in cucina... Sono abbastanza sicura di aver spento il fuoco..."
Turkish (TR): "......Çabucak gidip mutfağı kontrol edeceğim... Ateşi kapattığıma eminim......"

Steam (ST): After noticing a burnt smell, it was natural that Kumasawa, who had just been using the burner in the kitchen, suspected that her own slip-up had caused it. Kumasawa hastily dashed away.
Umineko Project (UP): After noticing a burnt smell, it was natural that Kumasawa, who had just been cooking in the kitchen, suspected that her own clumsiness had caused it. Kumasawa hastily dashed away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After noticing a burnt smell, it was natural that Kumasawa, who had just been using the fire in the kitchen, suspected that her own clumsiness had caused it. Kumasawa hastily dashed away.
PC Japanese (JP): 焦げた臭いがすれば、さっきまで厨房で火を扱った熊沢が、真っ先に自分の不手際かと疑いたくなるのも当然だった。熊沢はあたふたと駆け出していく。
Russian (RU): Логично, что, ощутив запах гари, Кумасава, которая недавно готовила на кухне, заподозрила, что он был вызван её рассеянностью. Она поспешила откланяться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após perceber o cheiro de queimado, era natural que a Kumasawa, que estava cozinhando há pouco, suspeitasse que sua falta de cuidado na cozinha tivesse causado isso. Kumasawa apressadamente saiu correndo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為是焦味，所以剛才一直在廚房用火的熊澤，理所當然地立刻懷疑是自己有疏忽。她慌慌張張地向廚房跑去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为是焦味，所以刚才一直在厨房用火的熊泽，理所当然地立刻怀疑是自己有疏忽。她慌慌张张地向厨房跑去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Essendosi accorta di un odore di bruciato, è naturale che Kumasawa, che aveva appena usato il fuoco in cucina, sospettasse che l'avesse causato la propria sbadataggine. Kumasawa scattò via rapidamente.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era naturale per Kumasawa che, dopo aver sentito un odore di bruciato, sospettasse che fosse dovuto alla propria sbadataggine, avendo operato ai fornelli in cucina fino a poco prima. E così, scattò via precipitosamente.
Turkish (TR): Yanık kokusunu fark ettikten sonra, mutfakta yemek pişirmekte olan Kumasawa'nın buna kendi sakarlığının neden olduğundan şüphelenmesi doğaldı. Kumasawa aceleyle fırladı.

Umineko Project (UP): "......Kanon, go with Kumasawa. Do not let her be alone."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): After nodding at Genji's order, Kanon went chasing after her.{n}...The others, although they did not run, also followed in order to search for the source of the smell.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After nodding at Genji's order, Kanon followed after her....He wasn't running, but as he followed her, he tried to search for the cause of the smell in other directions as well.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次の指示に頷き、嘉音は後を追っていった。…走るわけではないが、それ以外の面々も臭い元を探すため、その後を追った。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次の指示に頷き、嘉音は後を追っていった。{n}…走るわけではないが、それ以外の面々も臭い元を探すため、その後を追った。
Russian (RU): Ответив кивком на приказ Генджи, Канон рванул за ней.{n}...Остальные, хоть и не побежали, но проследовали за ними, чтобы обнаружить источник запаха.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após acatar à ordem de Genji, Kanon apressou‐se em correr atrás dela.{n}...Os outros, apesar de não terem corrido, também os seguiram com o intuito de descobrir a origem do cheiro.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): …由繪羽姑母一時心血來潮夾上去的一張收據，引出了門被封印著的事實，因而嫌疑落到了在這段時間裡，唯一出入過爺爺書房的夏妃伯母身上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …由绘羽姑母一时心血来潮夹上去的一张收据，引出了门被封印着的事实，因而嫌疑落到了在这段时间里，唯一出入过爷爷书房的夏妃伯母身上。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A causa dello scontrino di zia Eva, che aveva incastrato nella porta per capriccio, venne rivelato che la porta era rimasta sigillata, e zia Natsuhi divenne una sospetta, poichè durante quel lasso di tempo era stata l'unica ad entrare o uscire.

Steam (ST): Aunt Eva proposed a theory about how Aunt Natsuhi might've thrown Grandfather out the window... and left by the door herself.

Steam (ST): Or, like my theory, Grandfather could've hidden until the receipt was gone and left the room later. ...Basically, this door can be defeated with a handful of desperate tricks.

Speaker: Kanon
Steam (ST): "............In roulette, you bet on a number or the colors red or black, vying for a payoff. ...However, low-risk bets like black and red only offer a similarly low payoff."
Umineko Project (UP): "..................In roulette, you bet on a number or the colors red or black, vying for a payoff. ......However, low risk bets like red or black only offer a similarly low payoff."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "..................In roulette, you bet on a number or the colors red or black, vying for a payoff. However, low risk bets like black and red only offer a similarly low payoff."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………ルーレットは、数字と赤黒に賭けて配当を競い合う。……だが、赤か黒かのような、リスクの低い賭けは、その程度の配当しか与えられない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………………ルーレットは、数字と赤黒に賭けて配当を競い合う。……だが、赤か黒かのような、リスクの低い賭けは、その程度の配当しか与えられない」
Russian (RU): "..................В рулетке ты ставишь на число или на красное или чёрное, надеясь на выигрыш. Однако ставки с низким риском, вроде красного или чёрного, приносят такой же низкий выигрыш."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "..................Em uma roleta, você aposta em um número ou entre as cores vermelho e preto, almejando uma recompensa. ......Porém, apostas de baixo risco como apostar no vermelho ou no preto só oferecem recompensas igualmente baixas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………輪盤賭，是賭數字和紅黑贏取獎金的競爭遊戲。……但是，只押紅或黑的低風險賭博，只能得到與之相應的小額獎金。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………轮盘赌，是赌数字和红黑赢取奖金的竞争游戏。……但是，只押红或黑的低风险赌博，只能得到与之相应的小额奖金。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Nella roulette, scommetti su un numero o il rosso o il nero, gareggiando per una ricompensa. Ma le scommesse a basso rischio, come rosso o nero, danno comunque soltanto una ricompensa di basso livello."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Nel gioco della roulette, si compete su delle puntate che si scomettono su dei numeri, e sui colori del rosso e del nero... Tuttavia, le scommesse a basso rischio, come quelle sul rosso o sul nero, offrono solo vincite altrettanto basse."

Russian (RU): "...С другой стороны, если ты ставишь на что‐то, имеющее меньшую вероятность, ты получаешь выигрыш, пропорциональный риску. ............Господин называл достижение успеха вопреки астрономическому риску 'чудом', а получаемый в результате астрономический выигрыш — 'магией'."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Do mesmo jeito, se você apostar em algo com uma baixa probabilidade, você receberá uma recompensa proporcional ao risco. ............Meu Mestre chamava o êxito acerca de um risco astronômico de "milagre", e chamava a recompensa astronômica recebida em troca como resultado de "magia"."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…反之，通過押難以命中的格子，就可以得到與這風險成正比的大額獎金。…………老爺他，把在天文數字般的高風險中押對寶稱為“奇跡”，由此得到的天文數字般的獎金稱為“魔法”。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…反之，通过押难以命中的格子，就可以得到与这风险成正比的大额奖金。…………老爷他，把在天文数字般的高风险中押对宝称为“奇迹”，由此得到的天文数字般的奖金称为“魔法”。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... D'altra parte, se scommetti su qualcosa che ha meno probabilità, ricevi un pagamento proporzionale al rischio. ... Il Padrone chiamava ‘miracolo’ l'avere successo nonostante un rischio immenso, e chiamava ‘magia’ l'immenso pagamento guadagnato come ricompensa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...D'altra parte, se si scommette su qualcosa che ha un basso tasso di successo, si riceverà una vincita proporzionale al rischio... Il padrone chiamava ‘miracolo’ il riuscire a trionfare contro dei rischi astronomici, e definiva la vincita astronomica connessa al suo risultato col termine di  ‘magia’..."

Steam (ST): Roulette has a special pocket called "0", which means that the house takes everything in certain variants of the game. This means that all of the coins bet on the table will be swept up, just as though everyone has forfeit...
Umineko Project (UP): Roulette has a special pocket called "0", which means that the house takes everything in certain variants of the game—meaning that all of the coins bet on the table will be swept up, just as though everyone has forfeit...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Roulette has a special pocket called '0', which means that the house takes everything in certain variants of the game. This means that all of the coins bet on the table will be swept up, just as though everyone has forfeit...
PC Japanese (JP): ルーレットには“０”という特殊な目があり、ルールによっては親の総取りを意味し、盤面に賭けた全てのコインが流れてしまう、あたかも没収試合のような目がある…。
Russian (RU): У рулетки есть особая ячейка под названием "0", которая в некоторых вариантах игры означает, что заведение забирает всё. Это значит, что все поставленные фишки будут убраны, как если бы все проиграли...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma roleta tem uma casa especial chamada "0", que significa que essa casa leva a bolada em algumas variantes do jogo — significando que todas as moedas apostadas em uma mesa serão captadas, como se todos na mesa tivessem desistido...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在輪盤賭裡有“0”這個特殊的格子，按規則意味著莊家通殺，盤面裡押上的所有籌碼都會被收走，猶如直接棄權落敗一樣…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在轮盘赌里有“0”这个特殊的格子，按规则意味着庄家通杀，盘面里押上的所有筹码都会被收走，犹如直接弃权落败一样…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La roulette ha uno spazio speciale chiamato ‘0’, che significa che, secondo le regole, il banco prende tutto. Ciò indica che tutte le scommesse sul tavolo vengono prese, come se tutti avessero dato forfait...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La roulette ha una casella speciale dal valore ‘0’, ed è una casella per cui, secondo le regole, il banco prende tutto, ossia che tutte le fiches puntate sul tavolo vengono rimosse dal gioco, come se tutti i giocatori avessero dato forfait...
Turkish (TR): Rulette "0" adı verilen özel bir cep vardır, bu da oyunun belirli türevlerinde kasanın her şeyi aldığı anlamına gelir—yani masaya yatırılan tüm paralar tıpkı herkes kaybetmiş gibi silinip süpürülür...

Steam (ST): When Kanon raised the hatchet and tried to dive into the darkness, the darkness definitely sneered.
Umineko Project (UP): When Kanon swung the hatchet upwards and tried to dive into the darkness, the darkness definitely sneered.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音が鉈を振り上げて闇に飛び込もうとした時、闇は確かに嘲笑った。
Russian (RU): Когда Канон взмахнул тесаком и попытался броситься в темноту, темнота явно усмехнулась.

Umineko Project (UP): It sneered at that courage as vulgar, lazy, futile, and meaningless.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It sneered at that courage as vulgar, lazy, futile, and meaningless.

Russian (RU): Та рука, которая словно пыталась дотянуться до неба, теперь, когда тесак выпал, постепенно опускалась, и, наконец, прислонилась к его груди. Затем вторая рука сделала то же самое.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Battler era um homem que podia entender os sentimentos de dor e culpa no coração de uma pessoa.{n}...Então ele chorou. Com toda sua força.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …戰人，是個了解人心悲痛和悔恨的男人。{n}…所以，他哭了。用盡全身的力氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …战人，是个了解人心悲痛和悔恨的男人。{n}…所以，他哭了。用尽全身的力气。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Battler era un ragazzo che poteva capire i sentimenti di dolore e rimpianto nel cuore di una persona. ... Quindi pianse. Con tutta la sua forza.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...Battler era un ragazzo che comprendeva il dolore emotivo e il rimpianto... Perciò pianse. Con tutto sé stesso.
Turkish (TR): ...Battler, bir insanın kalbindeki acı ve pişmanlık duygularını anlayabilen bir çocuktu.{n}...Bu yüzden, tüm gücüyle ağladı.

Steam (ST): Natsuhi, who had always thought of Battler as a frank person, was a little surprised to find he had this delicate side, ...and at the same time, she understood how easily hurt the heart of a young person could be, so she held him.
Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi, who had always thought of Battler as a strong person, was a little surprised to find that he had this delicate side, ...and at the same time, understood how easily hurt the heart of a young person could be, so she held him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi, who had always thought of Battler as a frank person, was a little surprised to find that he had this delicate side, ...and at the same time, understood how easily hurt the heart of a young person could be, so she held him.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃は、豪放そうな性格だと思っていた戦人に、こんな繊細な一面があったことを知って少しだけ驚くと共に、…まだ未成年である傷つきやすい戦人の心を理解し、受け止めた。
Russian (RU): Нацухи, всегда считавшая Баттлера прямым и искренним человеком, была несколько обескуражена продемонстрированной им ранимостью. А ещё она поняла, как легко нанести душевную рану молодому человеку, поэтому она обняла Баттлера.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi, que sempre havia visto Battler como uma pessoa forte, estava agora surpresa ao encontrar nele um lado sentimental, ...mas ao mesmo tempo, entendia o quão frágil podia ser o coração de um jovem, então ela o abraçou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看到本以為性格豪爽的戰人竟也有如此纖細的一面，夏妃有些吃驚，…同時，也理解了仍未成年的戰人，內心仍然脆弱，因而抱住了他。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看到本以为性格豪爽的战人竟也有如此纤细的一面，夏妃有些吃惊，…同时，也理解了仍未成年的战人，内心仍然脆弱，因而抱住了他。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Natsuhi, che aveva sempre ritenuto Battler una persona schietta, era un po' sorpresa di scoprire che aveva questo lato sensibile... e allo stesso tempo, capiva come si poteva ferire facilmente il cuore di un giovane, per cui lo abbracciò.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Natsuhi fu leggermente sorpresa di scoprire questo lato sensibile di Battler, dato che lo riteneva una persona schietta... e lo abbracciò, comprendendo la fragilità del cuore di un ragazzo ancora giovane come lui.
Turkish (TR): Battler'ın her zaman güçlü bir insan olduğunu düşünen Natsuhi, onun bu hassas yönünü görünce biraz şaşırdı, ...ve aynı zamanda genç bir insanın kalbinin ne kadar kolay incinebileceğini anladı, bu yüzden ona sarıldı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi

Steam (ST): Battler, after sobbing into Natsuhi's chest for a while, wiped his tears with a bitter smile, as though he had been like that the whole time, and tried to appear as though he'd cried more than enough already...
Umineko Project (UP): Battler, after sobbing into Natsuhi's chest for a while, wiped his tears with a bitter smile, and tried to convey that he had cried more than enough already, just as he had done the times before...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Battler, after sobbing into Natsuhi's chest for a while, wiped his tears with a bitter smile, as though he had been like that the whole time, and tried to appear as though he had cried more than enough already...
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人はしばらくの間、夏妃の胸で号泣した後、これまでもそうだったように、涙を拭きながら苦笑いして、充分に泣き尽くしたことをアピールした…。
Russian (RU): Баттлер, поплакав некоторое время на груди у Нацухи, вытер слёзы с горькой улыбкой, как будто он только что не плакал и попытался сделать вид, что он уже давно всё выплакал...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Battler, depois de chorar no peito de Natsuhi por um tempo, limpou suas lágrimas com um sorriso sem graça e tentou se convencer que já havia chorado mais que o suficiente, como ele já havia feito várias vezes antes...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 戰人在夏妃懷裡大哭了片刻後，就如同前幾次一樣，擦掉眼淚露出了苦笑，表示自己已經哭夠了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 战人在夏妃怀里大哭了片刻后，就如同前几次一样，擦掉眼泪露出了苦笑，表示自己已经哭够了…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Battler, dopo aver pianto nel petto di Natsuhi per un po', si asciugò le lacrime con un sorrisetto amaro, come se fosse stato così per tutto il tempo, e provando ad apparire come se avesse pianto abbastanza...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopo aver pianto per un po' sul petto di Natsuhi, si asciugò le lacrime con un sorrisetto forzato, come aveva fatto finora, in modo da mostrare di aver pianto abbastanza...
Turkish (TR): Battler, bir süre Natsuhi'nin göğsünde hıçkıra hıçkıra ağladıktan sonra, acı bir gülümsemeyle gözyaşlarını sildi ve tıpkı daha önceki seferlerde yaptığı gibi, zaten yeterince ağladığını dile getirmeye çalıştı...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "Anyway, let's go back down for now. ...Protecting ourselves is a higher priority than finding the culprit. Tomorrow, the boat will arrive. After that happens, the police will come, and everything should be brought to light. ......There's no way the culprit can escape this island, no matter how much they struggle...!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Anyway, let's go back down for now. ......Protecting ourselves is a higher priority than finding the culprit. Tomorrow, the boat will arrive. After that happens, the police will come, and everything should be brought to light. .........There's no way the killer can escape this island, no matter how much they struggle...!!"

After that happens, the police will come, and everything should be brought to light. .........There's no way the culprit can escape this island, no matter how much they struggle...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「とにかく、一度、下に戻りましょう。……犯人を捜すより、自分たちの身を守る方が最優先です。明日になれば船が来る。そうすれば警察がやって来て、全てを白日の下に晒し出してくれるでしょう。………犯人がどう足掻こうとも、この島から逃げられるものですか…！！」
Russian (RU): "В любом случае, давай пока вернёмся назад. ......Самозащита должна быть для нас более предпочтительна, чем поимка преступника. Завтра прибудет катер. После того как это произойдёт, приедет полиция и всё выяснит. .........Преступнику же, как бы он не бился, с этого острова не сбежать!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "De qualquer forma, vamos voltar para baixo por enquanto. ......Nossa proteção é uma prioridade maior que encontrar o culpado. Amanhã, um barco virá. Depois disso, a polícia virá e tudo será passado a limpo. .........Não há nenhum modo do assassino escapar desta ilha, não importa o quanto ele tente...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「總之，先回下面一趟吧。……比起找犯人，應該優先保證我們自己的安全。到明天船就會來了。到時候警察會來讓一切真相大白的。………無論犯人怎麼掙扎，最後都是沒法逃出這個島的…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「总之，先回下面一趟吧。……比起找犯人，应该优先保证我们自己的安全。到明天船就会来了。到时候警察会来让一切真相大白的。………无论犯人怎么挣扎，最后都是没法逃出这个岛的…！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ad ogni modo, per ora, torniamo dentro. ... Proteggerci ha priorità maggiore rispetto a trovare il colpevole. Domani, la barca arriverà. Dopo che accadrà, la polizia arriverà, e tutto sarà portato alla luce. ... Il colpevole non può scappare dall'isola, non importa quanto ci provi...!!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Ad ogni modo, per ora torniamo giù... Proteggerci è una priorità più importante rispetto al trovare il colpevole. Domani arriverà il battello. Poi arriverà la polizia, e tutto verrà portato alla luce... Non importa quanto ci proverà, il colpevole non potrà scappare dall'isola...!!"
Turkish (TR): "Neyse, şimdilik geri dönelim. ......Kendimizi korumak, suçluyu bulmaktan daha öncelikli. Tekne yarın gelecek. Bu gerçekleştikten sonra polis gelecek ve her şey gün ışığına çıkarılacak. .........Katilin bu adadan ne kadar uğraşırsa uğraşsın kaçmasına imkan yok...!!!"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Kumasawa‐san e a Jessica os acompanharam.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 熊泽和朱志香也和他们一起过去了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kumasawa-san e Jessica li accompagnarono.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Kumasawa-san e Jessica li accompagnarono...
Turkish (TR): Kumasawa-san ve Jessica da onlara eşlik etmişti.

Steam (ST): ...Stains from Kanon-kun's blood remained on the floor.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Stains from Kanon‐kun's blood remained on the floor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Stains from Kanon-kun's blood remained on the floor.
PC Japanese (JP): …床には、嘉音くんが残した血溜まりが残っている。
Russian (RU): ...На полу остались пятна, образованные кровью Канон‐куна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Poças do sangue do Kanon‐kun ainda restavam no chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …地上，還留著嘉音君的血跡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …地上，还留着嘉音君的血迹。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Macchie del sangue di Kanon-kun erano rimaste sul pavimento.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Alcune delle macchie di sangue di Kanon-kun erano rimaste sul pavimento.
Turkish (TR): ...Kanon-kun'un kan lekeleri yerde kalmıştı.

Steam (ST): Judging by the large amount of blood lost and the ruthless shape of the weapon that had fallen carelessly to the ground, ...I figured that Doctor Nanjo's treatment would probably end in vain...
Umineko Project (UP): Judging by the large amount of blood lost and the ruthless shape of the weapon that had fallen unceremoniously to the ground, ......I figured that Doctor Nanjo's treatment would probably end in vain...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Judging by the large amount of blood lost and the ruthless shape of the weapon that had fallen carelessly to the ground, ......I figured that Doctor Nanjo's treatment would probably end in vain...
PC Japanese (JP): そのおびただしい出血量と、無造作に転がる凶器の無慈悲な形状から、……多分、南條先生の手当ては徒労に終わるだろうと思った…。
Russian (RU): Судя по огромному количеству потерянной крови и немилосердной форме орудия, беспечно обронённого на пол, я пришёл к выводу, что усилия доктора Нанджо наверняка не принесут плодов...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Julgando pela larga quantidade de sangue perdido e pelo formato impiedoso da arma que estava caída no chão, ......eu percebi que o atendimento do doutor Nanjo acabaria sendo em vão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從這一大灘血跡，和掉在地上的凶器那殘忍的形狀來看，……大概，南條大夫的急救只會徒勞無功地結束吧…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从这一大滩血迹，和掉在地上的凶器那残忍的形状来看，……大概，南条大夫的急救只会徒劳无功地结束吧…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A giudicare dalla gran quantità di sangue persa e dalla forma spietata dell'arma che era con noncuranza caduta a terra... immaginai che le cure del dottor Nanjo probabilmente sarebbero state inutili...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A giudicare dall'enorme quantità di sangue perso, e dalla forma cruenta dell'arma buttata a terra con noncuranza... immaginai che probabilmente le cure del dottor Nanjo sarebbero state inutili...
Turkish (TR): Kaybedilen büyük miktarda kana ve belirsiz bir şekilde yere düşen silahın vahşi şekline bakarak, ......Doktor Nanjo'nun tedavisinin muhtemelen sonuçsuz kalacağını düşündüm...

Steam (ST): That weapon was doubtlessly the same type that had been stuck in Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi's foreheads.
Umineko Project (UP): That weapon was doubtlessly the same type that had been stuck in Auntie Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi's foreheads.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That weapon was doubtlessly the same type that had been stuck in Eva oba-san and Hideyoshi oji-san's foreheads.
PC Japanese (JP): その凶器は紛れもなく、絵羽伯母さんたちの眉間に刺さっていたものと同じだった。
Russian (RU): Орудие, вне всяких сомнений, принадлежало к тому же типу, что и то, которым были убиты тётя Ева с дядей Хидэёши.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquela arma era, sem dúvidas, do mesmo tipo da que estava cravada nas testas da tia Eva e do tio Hideyoshi.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這把凶器毫無疑問，和插在繪羽姑母他們眉間的一模一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这把凶器毫无疑问，和插在绘羽姑母他们眉间的一模一样。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quell'arma era senza dubbio dello stesso tipo di quella che era stata conficcata nelle fronti di Eva oba-san e di Hideyoshi oji-san.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quell'arma era senz'altro dello stesso tipo di quelle conficcate nelle fronti di zia Eva e di zio Hideyoshi...
Turkish (TR): Bu silah şüphesiz Eva Teyze ve Hideyoshi Amca'nın alnına saplanmış olanla aynıydı.

Steam (ST): ......But wait, isn't the demonic design on the handle a little different...?
Umineko Project (UP): ......But wait, isn't the demonic design on the handle a little different...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But wait, isn't the demononic design on the handle a little different...?
PC Japanese (JP): ……いや、柄の部分の悪魔のデザインが少し違うだろうか…？
Russian (RU): ......Но постойте, разве демонический рисунок на рукоятке не имеет какое‐то отличие?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas, espere, o design demoníaco no cabo não é um pouco diferente...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不，把手上的惡魔的造型稍微有點不一樣嗎…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不，把手上的恶魔的造型稍微有点不一样吗…？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma aspetta, lo stemma demoniaco sul manico non è forse un po' diverso...?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Aspetta, il motivo demoniaco sull'impugnatura non era forse un po' diverso...?
Turkish (TR): ......Ama bir dakika, kabzadaki şeytani tasarım biraz farklı değil mi...?

Steam (ST): There seemed to be some small differences in that part. Still, as far as their overall shape was concerned, the weapons were all of the same type.
Umineko Project (UP): There seemed to be some small differences in that part. Still, as far as their overall shape was concerned, the weapons were all of the same type.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): その辺は多少の個性差だろう。とにかく、同じ形状の凶器という意味ではまったく同じだった。
Russian (RU): Похоже, в той части действительно наблюдались некоторые незначительные отличия. Когда рассматривалась вся форма орудий в целом, то становилось понятно, что они принадлежат к одному типу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pareciam ter algumas diferenças naquela parte. Ainda, já que todas tinham o mesmo formato considerando tudo, as armas deviam ser todas do mesmo tipo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這部分只是些許的個體差異而已吧。總之，以凶器形狀來說它們是一模一樣的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这部分只是些许的个体差异而已吧。总之，以凶器形状来说它们是一模一样的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembravano esserci alcune piccole differenze in quella zona. Ad ogni modo, per quanto riguardava la loro forma, le armi erano tutte dello stesso tipo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sembravano esserci delle piccole differenze. In ogni caso, per quanto riguardava la loro forma, le armi erano tutte dello stesso tipo.
Turkish (TR): O kısımda bazı küçük farklılıklar var gibi görünüyordu. Yine de, genel şekilleri söz konusu olduğunda, silahların hepsi aynı türdendi.

Steam (ST): Though it had seemed brutal, we'd left the weapons stuck into Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi to preserve the crime scene.
Umineko Project (UP): Though it had seemed brutal, we'd left the weapons stuck into Auntie Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi to preserve the crime scene.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Though it had seemed brutal, we'd left the weapons that had been stuck into Eva oba-san and Hideyoshi oji-san to preserve the crime scene.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんたちの時は、少々残酷だが、現場保全の意味もあり、凶器は突き刺さったままの状態にされた。
Russian (RU): Да, это было душераздирающее зрелище, но нам пришлось оставить орудия торчащими из тел тёти Евы и дяди Хидэёши, дабы оставить нетронутым место преступления.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apesar de parecer brutal, nós deixamos intocadas as armas que perfuravam a tia Eva e o tio Hideyoshi, para preservar a cena do crime.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 發現繪羽姑母他們遇害時，雖說有點殘忍，但是為了保護現場，凶器保持著插在屍體上的狀態。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 发现绘羽姑母他们遇害时，虽说有点残忍，但是为了保护现场，凶器保持着插在尸体上的状态。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nel caso di Eva oba-san e Hideyoshi oji-san era stato un po' brutale, ma dato che dovevamo preservare la scena del crimine, abbiamo lasciato le armi conficcate in loro.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era una decisione un po' cruenta, ma dato che volevamo preservare la scena del crimine, nel caso di zia Eva e di zio Hideyoshi avevamo lasciato le armi conficcate lì dov'erano...
Turkish (TR): Acımasızca görünse de, olay yerini korumak için silahları Eva Teyze ve Hideyoshi Amca'ya saplanmış halde bırakmıştık.

Steam (ST): ...So this was the first time we were able to have a perfect view of the entire weapon.
Umineko Project (UP): ...So this was the first time I was able to have a perfect view of the entire weapon.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...So this was the first time we were able to have a perfect view of the entire weapon.
PC Japanese (JP): …だからこうして、完全な状態で凶器全体を見るのはこれが初めてだった。
Russian (RU): ...Так что это был первый раз, когда мы могли подробно рассмотреть всё орудие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Assim, essa foi a primeira vez em que eu fui capaz de ter uma perfeita visão da arma inteira.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …所以，現在是第一次看清凶器的全貌。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …所以，现在是第一次看清凶器的全貌。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Quindi questa era la prima volta che fummo capaci di avere una visione completa dell'intera arma.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Pertanto, questa era la prima volta che potemmo vedere l'arma nella sua interezza.
Turkish (TR): ...Böylece ilk kez silahın tamamını mükemmel bir şekilde görebildim.

Steam (ST): As we had expected, the weapon was not bladed like a knife, but shaped like an icepick, ...or rather, a thin stake.
Umineko Project (UP): Indeed, the weapon was not bladed like a knife, but shaped like an icepick, ...or rather, a thin stake.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As we had expected, the weapon was not bladed like a knife, but shaped like an icepick, ...or rather, a thin stake.
PC Japanese (JP): やはり凶器は、ナイフのような刃物ではなく、アイスピック状、…いや、細い杭状のものだった。
Russian (RU): Как мы и ожидали, перед нами было оружие не с режущей кромкой, как у ножа, а нечто, по форме напоминающее шило... Или точнее, тонкий кол.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De fato, a arma não era uma lâmina, como uma faca, era mais como um picador de gelo, ...ou melhor, uma fina estaca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 果然凶器不是如匕首般的刀具，而是冰錐狀，…不，是纖細的樁狀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 果然凶器不是如匕首般的刀具，而是冰锥状，…不，是纤细的桩状。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Come aveva immaginato, l'arma non era affilata come un coltello, ma della forma di un rompighiaccio... o meglio, come un sottile pugnale.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Come avevo immaginato, non era un'arma da taglio come un coltello, ma aveva la forma di un punteruolo per il ghiaccio... o meglio, di un picchetto affusolato.
Turkish (TR): Gerçekten de silah bıçak gibi keskin değil, buz kıracağı, ...ya da daha doğrusu ince bir kazık şeklindeydi.

Steam (ST): And, ...it had a spiral-shaped pattern, sort of like a drill.
Umineko Project (UP): And also, ...it had a spiral‐shaped design, sort of like a drill?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And also, ...it had a spiral-shaped pattern that might have been like a drill.
PC Japanese (JP): しかもそこには、ドリル状？のような螺旋の意匠が施されていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかもそこには、ドリル状？　のような螺旋の意匠が施されていた。
Russian (RU): А ещё спиральная резьба на нём придавала ему сходства со сверлом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E também, ...ela tinha um design feito em espiral, meio que como uma broca?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且尖端上，還被做成了鑽頭狀？的螺旋形雕刻。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且尖端上，还被做成了钻头状？的螺旋形雕刻。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E inoltre... aveva un motivo a spirale che poteva ricordare una trivella.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E inoltre... era intagliato un motivo a spirale simile a... una trivella...?
Turkish (TR): Ve ayrıca, ...spiral şeklinde bir tasarımı vardı, bir çeşit matkap gibi?

Steam (ST): ...It looked like something that might be driven into the hearts of human sacrifices in some demonic ritual...
Umineko Project (UP): ...To use a disturbing analogy, it looked like something that might be driven into the hearts of human sacrifices in some demonic ritual...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It looked like something that might be driven into the hearts of human sacrifices in some demonic ritual...
PC Japanese (JP): …悪趣味に例えれば、生贄の心臓に杭を打つために作られたような、そんな悪魔の儀式ご用達っぽくも見える…。
Russian (RU): ...В общем, он выглядел как предмет, которым вполне могли пронзать сердца людских жертв в каких‐нибудь демонических ритуалах...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Usando uma analogia mais cruel, ela parecia alguma coisa que se cravaria em corações humanos em algum ritual demoníaco...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …惡趣味地比喻，就像是為了把樁打進活祭的心臟裡一般，用於諸如此類惡魔儀式的道具…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …恶趣味地比喻，就像是为了把桩打进活祭的心脏里一般，用于诸如此类恶魔仪式的道具…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Sembrava un qualcosa che poteva essere usato per affondarlo nel cuore dei sacrifici in qualche rituale demoniaco...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per fare un paragone poco lusinghiero, ricordava un qualcosa che poteva venire conficcato nel cuore di un sacrificio umano, e che veniva usato frequentemente nei rituali demoniaci...
Turkish (TR): ...Rahatsız edici bir benzetme yapmak gerekirse, şeytani bir ritüelde kurban edilen insanların kalbine saplanan bir şeye benziyordu...

Steam (ST): Including the handle, it was 25 centimeters long. Half of that was the stake-shaped part, which was stained with deep red blood.
Umineko Project (UP): Including the handle, it was about twenty‐five centimeters long. Half of that was the stake‐shaped part, which was stained with deep red blood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Including the handle, it was 25 centimeters long. Half of that was the stake shaped part, which was stained with deep red blood.
PC Japanese (JP): 全長は柄の部分も入れて２５ｃｍくらい。その半分ほどが真っ赤に血で染められた杭状の部分。
Russian (RU): Вместе с рукояткой его длина составляла 25 сантиметров. Половина её, испачканная в крови, была сделана в форме кола.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Incluindo o cabo, tinha cerca de 25 cm. Metade disso era a parte em forma de estaca, que estava tingida pelo sangue.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 把柄部也算進去全長二十五厘米左右。將近一半是被鮮血染紅的樁形部分。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 把柄部也算进去全长二十五厘米左右。将近一半是被鲜血染红的桩形部分。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Includendo il manico, era lungo 25 centimetri. Metà di questi erano occupati dalla parte del paletto, macchiato di sangue rosso brillante.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Includendo il manico, era lungo nel complesso 25 centimetri. La parte del picchetto, intinta di sangue rosso scarlatto, ne costituiva la metà di essi...
Turkish (TR): Sapıyla birlikte yaklaşık yirmi beş santimetre uzunluğundaydı. Bunun yarısı, koyu kırmızı kanla lekelenmiş olan kazık şeklindeki kısımdı.

Steam (ST): ......The length of the blood-stained part made it clear just how deeply it must have penetrated into Kanon-kun's chest...
Umineko Project (UP): ......The length of the blood‐stained part made it clear just how deeply it must have penetrated into Kanon‐kun's chest...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The length of the blood-stained part made it clear just how deeply it must have penetrated into Kanon-kun's chest...
PC Japanese (JP): ……血に染まった部分の長さが、嘉音くんの胸をどれだけ深々と貫いていたかを想像させる…。
Russian (RU): ......По покрытой кровью части можно было определить, как глубоко оно пронзило грудь Канон‐куна...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A largura em que estava a parte ensanguentada mostra o quão introduzida ela estava no corpo do Kanon‐kun...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……被血染紅的那部分的長度，不由得讓人想像，它刺進了嘉音君胸口多深…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……被血染红的那部分的长度，不由得让人想象，它刺进了嘉音君胸口多深…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... La lunghezza della parte macchiata di sangue rendeva facile immaginare quanto in profondità fosse penetrato nel petto di Kanon-kun...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La lunghezza della parte macchiata di sangue rendeva facile immaginare quanto in profondità avesse penetrato il petto di Kanon-kun...
Turkish (TR): ......Kan lekeli kısmın uzunluğu, Kanon-kun'un göğsüne ne kadar derin girmiş olduğunu açıkça gösteriyordu...

Steam (ST): But Aunt Natsuhi and the rest didn't even look at the weapon, and instead stood in front of the incinerator, where the horrible stench was emanating from.
Umineko Project (UP): But Aunt Natsuhi and the rest were not even looking at the weapon, instead standing in front of the incinerator, where the horrible stench was emanating from.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But Natsuhi oba-san and the rest didn't even look at the weapon, and instead stood in front of the incinerator, where the horrible stench was emanating from.
PC Japanese (JP): だが、夏妃伯母さんたちは凶器には目もくれず、凄まじい臭いを噴出している焼却炉の前にいた。
Russian (RU): Но тётя Нацухи и остальные даже не обратили внимания на оружие, а вместо этого стояли перед мусоросжигателем, откуда распространялось ужасное зловоние.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas a tia Natsuhi e o resto do pessoal não estavam nem mesmo olhando para a arma, estavam na verdade encarando o incinerador, de onde emanava aquele cheiro horrível.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，夏妃伯母他們根本不去留意凶器，而是全都聚集在了噴出猛烈惡臭的焚化爐前。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，夏妃伯母他们根本不去留意凶器，而是全都聚集在了喷出猛烈恶臭的焚化炉前。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma Natsuhi oba-san non guardò neanche l'arma, ed era di fronte all'inceneritore, che emanava un orribile olezzo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma zia Natsuhi e gli altri non diedero neanche uno sguardo all'arma, e si misero di fronte ad un inceneritore, che emanava un orribile olezzo.
Turkish (TR): Ancak Natsuhi Teyze ve diğerleri silaha bakmıyor, bunun yerine korkunç kokunun yayıldığı çöp fırınının önünde duruyorlardı.

Steam (ST): They must have dragged it out. Dragged out "that thing" which had been burning in the furnace.
Umineko Project (UP): They had probably pulled {i:that} out of the furnace, where it must have been burning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They had probably pulled out 'that', which had been burnt up in the furnace.
PC Japanese (JP): かつて、炉の中にくべられていたそれを、引きずり出したのだろう。
Russian (RU): Похоже, им удалось извлечь "то", что было сожжено в печи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles provavelmente puxaram {i:aquilo} para fora da fornalha, onde deveria estar sendo queimado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們似乎把剛才在爐子裡燒著的東西拉出來了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们似乎把刚才在炉子里烧着的东西拉出来了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Prima, forse ‘quello’ era stato bruciato nella fornace e poi tirato fuori.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A quanto pareva avevano tirato fuori una {i:cosa}. Una cosa che stava bruciando in una fornace...
Turkish (TR): Muhtemelen {i:onu} yanıyor olması gereken fırından çıkarmışlardı.

Steam (ST): ..."It" was still smoldering and kept sending out dense waves of that awfully unpleasant smell...
Umineko Project (UP): ...It was still smoldering and kept sending out dense waves of that awfully unpleasant smell...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...'It' was still smoldering and kept sending out dense waves of that awfully unpleasant smell...
PC Japanese (JP): …それは未だ燻り、不快この上ない悪臭をもうもうと放ち続けていた…。
Russian (RU): ..."Оно" всё ещё дымилось и распространяло волны ужасного запаха...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ainda estava fumegando e soltando densas ondas daquele cheiro desagradável...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …那東西還冒著煙，繼續散發著讓人無法忍受的惡臭…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …那东西还冒着烟，继续散发着让人无法忍受的恶臭…。

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): "...The Master was born with six toes on both of his feet. ...Consequently, the Master was entrusted with the revival of the Ushiromiya family."
Umineko Project (UP): "......The Master had these uniquely characteristic toes since birth. ...Consequently, the Master was entrusted with the revival of the Ushiromiya family."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Since the Master was born, both of his feet have had six toes. ...Consequently, the Master was entrusted with the revival of the Ushiromiya family."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お館様はお生まれの時から両足の指がそれぞれ６本でした。…そして、ゆえにお館様は右代宮家の再興を託されたのです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……お館様はお生まれの時から両足の指に特徴がございました。…そして、ゆえにお館様は右代宮家の再興を託されたのです」
Russian (RU): "......С самого рождения господин оказался наделён шестью пальцами на обеих ногах. ...В результате на него было возложено возрождение семьи Уширомия."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......O mestre tinha essas características tão únicas nos seus pés desde o nascimento. ...Consequentemente, o Mestre foi encarregado do renascimento da família Ushiromiya."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……老爺出生時兩只腳的腳趾就有這樣的特徵。…也正因如此，復興右代宮家的重任才託付到了老爺身上。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……老爷出生时两只脚的脚趾就有这样的特征。…也正因如此，复兴右代宫家的重任才托付到了老爷身上。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Sin da quando il Padrone è nato, entrambi i suoi piedi avevano sei dita. {n}Di conseguenza, al Padrone era stata affidata la rinascita della famiglia Ushiromiya."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Il padrone possedeva sei dita per piede da quando era nato...{n}E di conseguenza, al padrone venne affidato il risollevamento della famiglia Ushiromiya."
Turkish (TR): "......Efendi doğduğundan beri bu benzersiz nitelikteki ayak parmaklarına sahipti. ...Dolayısıyla, Ushiromiya ailesinin yeniden canlandırılması görevi Efendi'ye verildi."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "I have heard that since long ago, cases of polydactyly were common in the Ushiromiya family. ...It's probably hereditary."
Umineko Project (UP): "I have heard that since long ago, cases of polydactyly were common in the Ushiromiya family. ...It's probably hereditary."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「右代宮家には昔から、生まれつき多指症の方が多かったそうです。…多分、遺伝的なものでしょう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「右代宮家には昔から、生まれつき多指症の方が多かったそうです。…多分、遺伝的なものでしょう」
Russian (RU): "Я слышала, что случаи многопалости были распространены в семье Уширомия уже очень давно. ...Должно быть, это наследственное."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu ouvi que, desde muito tempo atrás, casos de polidactilia eram comuns na família Ushiromiya. ...Provavelmente é hereditário."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「右代宮家似乎從很久以前開始，就經常有天生多指症的人。…大概，是遺傳上的原因吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「右代宫家似乎从很久以前开始，就经常有天生多指症的人。…大概，是遗传上的原因吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ho sentito che sin da molto tempo fa, i casi di polidattilia erano comuni nella famiglia Ushiromiya. ... Probabilmente è ereditaria."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Ho sentito che nella famiglia Ushiromiya i casi di polidattilia fossero da sempre comuni... Probabilmente è qualcosa di genetico."
Turkish (TR): "Çok eskiden beri Ushiromiya ailesinde polidaktili vakalarının yaygın olduğunu duymuştum. ...Muhtemelen kalıtsal."

Steam (ST): Polydactyly literally means "many fingers".
Umineko Project (UP): Polydactyly literally means "many fingers".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Polydactyly literally means 'many fingers'.
PC Japanese (JP): 多指症ってのは、書いて字の如し。
Russian (RU): Многопалость буквально значит "много пальцев".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Polidactilia literalmente significa "muitos dedos".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 多指症，就如字面意義。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 多指症，就如字面意义。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Polidattilia letteralmente significa ‘molte dita’.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Polidattilia significa letteralmente ‘molte dita’.
Turkish (TR): Polidaktili kelimenin tam anlamıyla "fazla parmak" demektir.

Steam (ST): Because of a little mistake by God when the person is born, one of their toes or fingers splits into two, and the total number increases.
Umineko Project (UP): Because of a little mistake by God when the person is born, one of their toes or fingers splits into two, and the total number increases.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because of a little mistake by god when the person is born, one of their toes or fingers splits into two, and the total number increases.
PC Japanese (JP): 生まれる時のちょいとした神さまのミスで１本になるはずの指が２本に分かれてしまって、増えてしまうことがあるのだ。
Russian (RU): Из‐за небольшой ошибки Творца, когда человек рождается, один из его пальцев делится на два, и общее количество увеличивается.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Devido a um pequeno erro cometido por Deus no nascimento de uma pessoa, um dos seus dedos se divide em dois, e o número total aumenta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於神明小小的疏忽，人在出生時偶爾會發生，本該是一根的指頭分開變成兩根的情況。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于神明小小的疏忽，人在出生时偶尔会发生，本该是一根的指头分开变成两根的情况。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A causa di un piccolo scherzo del destino, quando la persona nasce, uno dei suoi alluci o delle sue altre dita si divide in due, e il numero totale di esse aumenta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando qualcuno nasce, una delle dita si divide in due a causa di un piccolo errore degli dei, aumentandone il numero.
Turkish (TR): Kişi doğduğunda Tanrı'nın yaptığı küçük bir hata nedeniyle ayak ya da el parmaklarından biri ikiye ayrılır ve toplam sayı artar.

Steam (ST): But a big deal isn't usually made of polydactyly in the world at large. That's because it isn't a disease, just something people are born with.
Umineko Project (UP): But a big deal isn't usually made of polydactyly in the world at large.{n}That's because it isn't a disease, but something people are born with.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But a big deal isn't usually made of polydactyly in the world at large. That's because it isn't a disease, just something people are born with.
PC Japanese (JP): ただ、多指症が世間で騒がれることはそうそうない。なぜなら、これは病気ではなく、生まれつきのものだからだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ただ、多指症が世間で騒がれることはそうそうない。{n}なぜなら、これは病気ではなく、生まれつきのものだからだ。
Russian (RU): Но в целом в мире из‐за многопалости особо шум не поднимают.{n}Потому что это не болезнь, а то, с чем человек родился.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas não fazem muita alarde acerca da polidactilia em nenhum lugar do mundo.{n}Isso é porque não é uma doença, mas sim algo que nasce com a pessoa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只是，多指症基本上從沒在社會上引起過關注。{n}因為，這並不是疾病，而是天生的現象。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只是，多指症基本上从没在社会上引起过关注。{n}因为，这并不是疾病，而是天生的现象。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma la polidattilia nel mondo in generale non comporta un grande problema. Questo perché non è una malattia, semplicemente qualcosa con cui le persone nascono.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma è raro che la polidattilia causi scalpore. Questo perché è una condizione con cui si nasce, non una malattia.
Turkish (TR): Ama genellikle dünyada polidaktili büyük bir meseleymiş gibi konuşulmaz.{n}Çünkü bu bir hastalık değil, insanların doğuştan sahip olduğu bir şeydir.

Steam (ST): So while they are still babies, at about the time they turn one year old, they can be taken to the hospital and given surgery to make them normal.
Umineko Project (UP): So the hospital is already aware of it when they are still babies, and at about the time they turn one year old, they are given surgery to make them normal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So while they are still babies, at about the time they turn one year old, they can be taken to the hospital and given surgery to make them normal.
PC Japanese (JP): だから赤ん坊の時にもう病院は把握していて、１歳くらいになったら、手術して元通りに直してしまう。
Russian (RU): Поэтому, пока они ещё младенцы с приблизительным возрастом в один год, их можно доставить в больницу и при помощи хирургии сделать обычными.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, os hospitais geralmente já têm noção do fato enquanto eles são ainda bebês e, quando fazem um ano, recebem uma cirurgia para tornar seus pés normais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以在孩子的嬰兒階段時，醫院就已經了解情況，等長到一歲左右會進行手術，使其變得和一般人一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以在孩子的婴儿阶段时，医院就已经了解情况，等长到一岁左右会进行手术，使其变得和一般人一样。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò quando sono ancora bambini, generalmente quando compiono un anno, possono essere portati all'ospedale e con un intervento chirurgico tornano normali.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perciò, quando il paziente è un neonato, l'ospedale è già consapevole del fenomeno, e quando esso compie un anno, si effettua un'operazione per ripristinare la mano.
Turkish (TR): Bu yüzden hastane daha bebekken bunun farkına varır ve yaklaşık bir yaşına geldiklerinde onları normal hale getirmek için ameliyat edilirler.

Steam (ST): Even a child with polydactyly can be treated before they become aware, so they might not even remember it themselves.
Umineko Project (UP): So, even if a child has polydactyly, it is treated before they become self‐aware, so they might not even remember it themselves.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even a child with polydactyly can be treated before they become aware, so they might not even remember it themselves.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、仮に多指症だったとしても物心が付く前に治療されてしまっていて、子ども自身は覚えてすらいないわけだ。
Russian (RU): Младенец с многопалостью может пройти лечение ещё до того, как начнёт толком воспринимать своё окружение, поэтому у него могут не сохраниться воспоминания об этом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, mesmo se uma criança tenha polidactilia, ela é tratada antes que tenha consciência; por isso elas geralmente acabam mesmo sem saber.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，即便孩子有多指症，也早在還不懂事的時候就治好了，就連他自己都不會記得。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，即便孩子有多指症，也早在还不懂事的时候就治好了，就连他自己都不会记得。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi anche se hanno la polidattilia, il bambino viene guarito prima che ne diventi consapevole, ed è probabile che neanche se ne ricordi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perciò, anche se un bambino è polidattile, viene trattato prima che ne diventi consapevole, e potrebbe persino non ricordarsene.
Turkish (TR): Dolayısıyla, bir çocukta polidaktili olsa bile, kendi bilincine varmadan önce tedavi edilir, bu yüzden kendileri bile hatırlamayabilirler.

Steam (ST): By the way, it seems that there's a possibility for this to occur in one out of every two thousand babies, so even though it's not usually seen, it isn't that rare at all.
Umineko Project (UP): Incidentally, it seems that it can occur with a probability of about one in every two thousand babies, so even though it's not usually seen, it isn't that rare at all.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By the way, it seems that there is a possibility for this to occur in one out of every two thousand babies, so even though it's not usually seen, it isn't that rare at all.
PC Japanese (JP): ちなみに、赤ん坊二千人に１人くらいの可能性で起こりえるものらしいので、人目には触れないながらも、決して珍しいものではない。
Russian (RU): Между прочим, похоже, что такая аномалия может приключиться у одного из двух тысяч детей, поэтому, хотя это обычно не замечается, не такая уж это и редкость.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Incidentalmente, parece que isso pode ocorrer com uma probabilidade de um em cada dois mil bebês, então mesmo que não seja comumente visto, não é tão raro assim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 順帶一提，這似乎是平均兩千個嬰兒裡就有一個的高發性現象，雖說不是人人都見過，但也絕不是什麼稀奇的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 顺带一提，这似乎是平均两千个婴儿里就有一个的高发性现象，虽说不是人人都见过，但也绝不是什么稀奇的事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Comunque, sembra che le probabilità che accada una cosa del genere siano di una su oltre duemila, quindi anche se non si vede tutti i giorni, non è affatto strano.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A tal proposito, sembra che le probabilità siano di uno su duemila neonati, per cui non è affatto eccezionale, anche se non è un fatto noto al pubblico.
Turkish (TR): Bu arada, her iki bin bebekten birinde görülme olasılığı var gibi görünüyor, yani genellikle görülmese de o kadar da nadir değil.

Steam (ST): Speaking of which, I think Uncle Hideyoshi mentioned something to me long ago. ...Something about how even Toyotomi Hideyoshi, the man who unified Japan at the end of the Sengoku period, had six fingers on one hand...
Umineko Project (UP): Speaking of which, I think Uncle Hideyoshi mentioned something to me long ago. ...Something about how even Toyotomi Hideyoshi, the man who unified Japan at the end of the Sengoku period, possessed six fingers on one hand...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Speaking of which, I think Hideyoshi oji-san mentioned something to me long ago. ...Something about how even Toyotomi Hideyoshi, the man who unified Japan at the end of the Sengoku period, possessed six fingers on one hand...
PC Japanese (JP): そう言えば、秀吉伯父さんに昔、聞かされたことがあるような。…あの豊臣秀吉も手の指が６本あったんだとか…。
Russian (RU): Кстати говоря, я помню, как дядя Хидэёши давно кое‐что мне рассказал. ...Кое‐что о том, что даже Тоётоми Хидэёши, объединивший Японию под конец периода Сэнгоку, имел шесть пальцев на одной руке...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pensando nisso, eu acho que o tio Hideyoshi já mencionou algo parecido há um tempo atrás. ...Algo sobre como Toyotomi Hideyoshi, o homem que unificou o Japão no fim do período Sengoku, possuía seis dedos em uma mão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 說起來，以前好像還聽秀吉姑父講過。…那位豐臣秀吉的手也有六個指頭…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 说起来，以前好像还听秀吉姑父讲过。…那位丰臣秀吉的手也有六个指头…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A tal proposito, una volta Hideyoshi oji-san mi disse una cosa. ... Qualcosa circa il fatto che Toyotomi Hideyoshi, l'uomo che unificò il Giappone alla fine dell'epoca Sengoku, possedeva sei dita in una mano...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A tal proposito, tempo fa zio Hideyoshi mi disse una cosa... Ovvero, che anche Hideyoshi Toyotomi possedeva sei dita per mano...
Turkish (TR): Bu konu açılmışken, sanırım Hideyoshi Amca uzun zaman önce bana bir şeyden bahsetmişti. ...Sengoku döneminin sonunda Japonya'yı birleştiren Toyotomi Hideyoshi'nin bile bir elinde altı parmağı olduğuna dair bir şey...

Steam (ST): According to Aunt Natsuhi, among the many Ushiromiya Family Heads, the ones most praised for their wisdom all had polydactyly.
Umineko Project (UP): According to Aunt Natsuhi, among the many Ushiromiya family heads, the ones praised most for their wisdom had all possessed polydactyly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): According to Natsuhi oba-san, among the many Ushiromiya family heads, the ones praised most for their wisdom had all possessed polydactyly.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃伯母さんが言うには、右代宮家の歴代当主の中でも名君と讃えられた何人かが、みんな多指症だったらしい。
Russian (RU): По словам тёти Нацухи, среди многих глав семьи Уширомия наибольшей мудростью отличались те, кто обладал многопалостью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De acordo com a tia Natsuhi, dentro dos vários chefes da família Ushiromiya, os mais apreciados por sua sabedoria eram os que tinham polidactilia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 根據夏妃伯母所說，右代宮家歷代當主之中被奉為明君的幾位，似乎都有多指症。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 根据夏妃伯母所说，右代宫家历代当主之中被奉为明君的几位，似乎都有多指症。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Da quel che ha detto Natsuhi oba-san, nella storia della famiglia Ushiromiya, dei molti capi famiglia onorati per la loro saggezza, tutti quanti erano affetti da polidattilia.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Da quel che ha detto zia Natsuhi, molti dei capofamiglia nella storia della famiglia Ushiromiya, onorati per la loro saggezza nel governare, erano affetti da polidattilia...
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi Teyze'ye göre, Ushiromiya ailesinin birçok reisi arasında bilgelikleriyle en çok övülenlerin hepsi polidaktiliymiş.

Steam (ST): ...Because of that, when Grandfather was born, his relatives were all excited at the thought that he might become another wise leader. And, when the leading relatives all died in the Great Kanto Earthquake, it was apparently argued that Grandfather should be the one to restore the family, because of the auspicious sign of his birth. If Grandfather hadn't disliked his position as the Head so much, this sixth toe probably would've been pretty lucky for him.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Because of that, when Grandfather was born, his relatives were all excited at the thought that he might become another wise leader. And, when the leading relatives all died in the Great Kanto Earthquake, it was apparently argued that if anyone could restore the family from that, it would be Grandfather, because of the auspicious sign of his birth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Because of that, when Grandfather was born, his relatives were all excited at the thought that he might become another wise leader. And, when the leading relatives all died in the Great Kanto Earthquake, it was apparently argued Grandfather should be the one to restore the family because of the auspicious sign of his birth.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そのため、祖父さまが生まれた時、名君の再来かと親族たちに騒がれたのだそうだ。で、関東大震災で主だった親族たちが全滅し、そこからお家を再興できるのは、吉祥の徴を持って生まれてきた祖父さまだ、ってな論法になったらしい。
Russian (RU): ......Поэтому, когда родился дедушка, все приходили в волнение при мысли, что он может стать ещё одним мудрым лидером. И когда все главные родственники погибли во время Великого Землетрясения в Канто, все сошлись во мнении, что дедушка должен стать тем, кто возродит семью из‐за своего отличительного признака с самого рождения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Por causa disso, quando o vovô nasceu, seus parentes estavam muito empolgados com o fato que ele poderia vir a se tornar um excelente líder. E quando todos os parentes na liderança morreram, no Grande Terremoto de Kanto, aparentemente foi argumentado que se alguém pudesse restaurar a família, esse alguém seria o vovô, por causa do auspicioso sinal que lhe foi dado no nascimento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……因此，據說爺爺出生時，還在親戚之間引起騷動，說他是明君再臨。之後由於關東大地震，右代宮家的主要人物全都去世，好像這幫親戚就認為，要在這種情況下復興右代宮家，只能靠出生時就帶有吉兆的爺爺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……因此，据说爷爷出生时，还在亲戚之间引起骚动，说他是明君再临。之后由于关东大地震，右代宫家的主要人物全都去世，好像这帮亲戚就认为，要在这种情况下复兴右代宫家，只能靠出生时就带有吉兆的爷爷。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Perciò, quando nacque il Nonno, i suoi parenti erano tutti eccitati al pensiero che sarebbe stato un altro saggio capo famiglia. E quando questi parenti morirono tutti nel Grande Terremoto del Kanto, era scontato che l'unico adatto a resuscitare la famiglia sarebbe stato il Nonno, nato con un segno favorevole.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perciò, quando nacque nostro nonno, i suoi parenti erano estasiati all'idea del ritorno di un leader assennato. E quando i parenti della linea principale perirono nel Grande Terremoto del Kanto, fu scontato che fosse lui, nato con un segno di buon auspicio, ad avere le capacità di risollevare la famiglia.
Turkish (TR): ......Bu nedenle, Büyükbaba doğduğunda, akrabalarının hepsi onun başka bir bilge lider olabileceği düşüncesiyle heyecanlanmış. Ve önde gelen akrabaların hepsi Büyük Kanto Depremi'nde öldüğünde, görünüşe göre aileyi bundan kurtarabilecek biri varsa, onun doğumunun kutsanmış işareti nedeniyle Büyükbaba olacağı tartışılıyordu.

Steam (ST): ...Come to think of it, I've heard about some country where it's believed people with polydactyly should be treated as gods and revered...
Umineko Project (UP): If Grandfather thought being the head was not a bad gig, this sixth toe must have been pretty lucky for him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If Grandfather hadn't disliked his position as the head overly much, this sixth toe must have been pretty lucky for him.
PC Japanese (JP): もし祖父さまが当主もまんざらじゃないって思ったんなら、その６本目は幸運の指ってことになるのかもな。
Russian (RU): Если бы дедушке нравилось его положение главы, эта шестипалая нога стала бы для него большой удачей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se o vovô gostava da ideia de ser o chefe da família, esse sexto dedo deve ter vindo a calhar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果爺爺自己也覺得做當主沒什麼不好的話，這第六根指頭也可以說是幸運之指啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果爷爷自己也觉得做当主没什么不好的话，这第六根指头也可以说是幸运之指啊。

Steam (ST): Since, according to Genji, the strength of the flames hadn't been that strong, the body must have started burning a long time ago, so that stench could slowly creep out of the furnace and fill the room bit by bit, eventually pouring out and climbing up the staircase.
Umineko Project (UP): Since, according to Genji‐san, the flames hadn't been that strong, the body must have started burning a long time ago, and that stench must have slowly crept out of the furnace and filled the room bit by bit, eventually pouring out and climbing up the staircase.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Since, according to Genji, the strength of the flames hadn't been that strong, the body must have started burning a long time ago, so that stench could slowly creep out of the furnace and fill the room bit by bit, eventually pouring out and climbing up the staircase.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次さんが言うには、火勢がそんなに強くなかったので、だいぶ前から焼かれていて、炉から漏れ出した臭いが室内に少しずつ充満し、あふれ出して階段を登ってきたのではないかという。
Russian (RU): Поскольку, согласно Генджи, сила огня была не такой уж большой, тело должно было начать гореть очень давно, чтобы эта вонь смогла медленно выползти из топки и потихоньку заполнить помещение, а потом просочиться и поползти вверх по лестнице.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, de acordo com o Genji‐san, as chamas não estavam tão altas, então o corpo deve ter começado a queimar há um longo tempo atrás, e aquele fedor deve ter escapado devagar para fora da fornalha e preenchido a sala pouco a pouco, eventualmente a inundando e avançando para as escadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 根據源次所說，由於火勢不是很強，估計已經燒了相當長一段時間，爐中冒出的臭氣應該是慢慢充滿室內，滿出來後才沿著台階瀰漫出去的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 根据源次所说，由于火势不是很强，估计已经烧了相当长一段时间，炉中冒出的臭气应该是慢慢充满室内，满出来后才沿着台阶弥漫出去的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Da quel che disse Genji, dal momento che la forza delle fiamme non era molto elevata, potrebbe aver cominciato a bruciare molto tempo fa, e la puzza proveniente dalla fornace potrebbe aver riempito la stanza a poco a poco, per poi risalire le scale e appestare la villa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Da quel che disse Genji, dal momento che la forza delle fiamme non era molto elevata, potrebbe aver bruciato da molto tempo, e la puzza proveniente dalla fornace potrebbe aver riempito gradualmente la stanza, per poi straripare e risalire sù per le scale...

Umineko Project (UP): ......The probability that someone outside our group was lurking around committing the crimes was now overwhelmingly high, and there was also a good chance that this person was walking around with something like a master key.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The possibility that someone outside our group had snuck in and committed the crime was overwhelmingly high, and there was also a good chance that this person was walking around with something like a master key.
PC Japanese (JP): ……俺たち以外の誰かが潜んでいて犯行に及んでいる可能性が限りなく高くなり、しかもそいつはマスターキーのようなものを持ち歩いている可能性も高い。
Russian (RU): ......Вероятность того, что кто‐то не из нашей группы прокрался и совершил преступление, была чрезвычайно высока. Также вполне возможно, что этот человек носит с собой что‐нибудь вроде универсального ключа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A probabilidade de que alguém de fora do nosso grupo estava explorando por aí e cometendo crimes era agora incrivelmente alta, e também tinha uma bela chance de que essa pessoa estava andando por aí com uma chave mestra ou algo similar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……除我們以外的某人暗中埋伏並犯罪的可能性，大大提高了，而且這傢伙還有很大可能隨身帶著類似總鑰匙的東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……除我们以外的某人暗中埋伏并犯罪的可能性，大大提高了，而且这家伙还有很大可能随身带着类似总钥匙的东西。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Le probabilità che qualcuno al di fuori del nostro gruppo si stesse celando nell'ombra per compiere i suoi crimini, erano particolarmente alte, ed era molto probabile che portasse con sé una sorta di passepartout...
Turkish (TR): ......Grubumuzun dışından birinin suç işlemek için etrafta dolaşıyor olma ihtimali artık çok yüksekti, ve bu kişinin elinde master anahtar gibi bir şeyle dolaşıyor olma ihtimali de çok yüksekti.

Umineko Project (UP): ...After all, the doors and windows throughout the mansion had been checked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): Does this crime confirm that a 19th person exists? There's still that contradiction, since they're trying to tout their existence without ever showing themselves once.
Umineko Project (UP): After this latest crime, can we now be sure that a 19th person exists?{n}They haven't shown themselves once, and yet they're trying to tout their existence.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After this latest crime, can we be sure that a 19th person exists? They haven't shown themselves once, and yet someone's trying to tout their existence.
PC Japanese (JP): この一件で、１９人目が存在することは確定したのか？今までまったく姿を現さず、にもかかわらず存在をアピールするという矛盾。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): この一件で、１９人目が存在することは確定したのか？{n}今までまったく姿を現さず、にもかかわらず存在をアピールするという矛盾。
Russian (RU): После этого последнего преступления, можем ли мы быть уверены в существовании 19‐го человека?{n}Он себя ни разу не показал, но кто‐то всё равно пытается убедить нас в его существовании.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois desse último crime, podemos agora ter certeza se existe uma 19ª pessoa?{n}Ela não se mostrou uma única vez, mas mesmo assim preferimos acreditar na sua existência.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 通过这件事，可以确定有第十九人存在吗？{n}至今为止从未现身，然而却总在显耀自己的存在，这很矛盾。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Arrivati a tal punto, era stata assodata l'esistenza di una 19ª persona? Tuttavia, era presente la contraddizione di voler rendere nota la propria esistenza, senza mostrarsi nemmeno una volta fino ad allora.

Steam (ST): Along with Kyrie-san's chessboard theory, I've been using this contradiction to deny the existence of a 19th person.
Umineko Project (UP): Along with Kyrie‐san's chessboard theory, I've been using this contradiction to deny the existence of a 19th person.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Along with Kyrie-san's chessboard theory, I've been using this contradiction to deny the existence of a 19th person.
PC Japanese (JP): それを俺は、霧江さんのチェス盤理論で、逆に１９人目を否定してきた。
Russian (RU): Вместе с теорией Кирие‐сан о шахматной доске, я использовал это противоречие для отрицания существования 19‐го человека.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Juntamente com a teoria do tabuleiro de xadrez da Kyrie‐san, eu vim usando dessa contradição para negar a existência de uma 19ª pessoa.

Steam (ST): ...By spinning the chessboard around once more, the very fact that this crime makes it perfectly obvious that a 19th person exists... means that the existence of the 19th person is even less plausible. As long as that 19th person doesn't show themselves in front of us...!
Umineko Project (UP): ...By flipping over the chessboard once more, the very fact that this crime makes it perfectly obvious that a 19th person exists...means that the existence of the 19th person is even less possible. As long as that 19th person doesn't show themselves in front of us...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...By flipping the chessboard over once more, the very fact that this crime makes it perfectly obvious that a 19th person exists... means that the existence of the 19th person is even less possible. As long as that 19th person doesn't show themselves in front of us...!
PC Japanese (JP): …またしてもチェス盤をひっくり返すならば。これほど明らかに１９人目の存在がはっきりするなら、…ならばこそ、１９人目の存在など、なお一層ありえないということになる。その１９人目が姿を現さない限り…！
Russian (RU): ...Если повернуть шахматную доску ещё раз, сам факт того, что это преступление делает абсолютно очевидным существование 19‐го человека... Означает, что существование 19‐го человека ещё менее вероятно. По крайней мере до тех пор, пока этот 19‐й человек не покажется перед нами!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Virando o tabuleiro mais uma vez, o preciso fato de que este crime torna perfeitamente óbvio que uma 19ª pessoa existe...significa que a existência da 19ª pessoa é ainda menos possível. Enquanto essa 19ª pessoa não se mostrar na nossa frente...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …如果這次也把國際象棋盤翻轉過來思考的話。既然案件已經如此清楚地指明了有第十九人存在，…那麼這第十九人的存在反而變得更加不可能了。只要這第十九人沒有現身…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): …如果这次也把国际象棋盘翻转过来思考的话。既然案件已经如此清楚地指明了有第十九人存在，…那么这第十九人的存在反而变得更加不可能了。只要这第十九人没有现身…！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ruotando ancora una volta la scacchiera, il fatto che questo crimine renda perfettamente ovvio che una diciannovesima persona esiste... significa che l'esistenza di una diciannovesima persona è ancora meno possibile. Finché quella diciannovesima persona non si mostra di fronte a noi...!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dovevo rigirare nuovamente la scacchiera. Se era così evidente l'esistenza di una 19ª persona... allora era ancora più implausibile che essa potesse esistere.{n}Non finché quella 19ª persona non si sarebbe palesata di fronte a noi...!

Steam (ST): ...If the culprit could get Grandfather out through the door sealed by the receipt, if they could kill Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi from the other side of a door sealed by a chain, ...then could they possibly go so far as to create a fictional 19th person through strange tricks and devices...?!?!

PC Japanese (JP): ……レシートで封印した扉から祖父さまを連れ出し、チェーンで封印した扉の向こうの絵羽伯母さんたちを殺せた犯人なら、……怪しげなトリックや仕掛けで、見事架空の１９人目を生み出すことも可能なのか…？！？！
Russian (RU): ......Если преступник смог вытащить дедушку через дверь с вложенным чеком, если он смог убить тётю Еву и дядю Хидэёши с другой стороны двери, запертую на цепочку... То могут ли они создать даже вымышленного 19‐го человека с помощью странных трюков и устройств?!!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se o culpado pudesse levar o vovô para fora através da porta selada pelo recibo, se eles pudessem matar a tia Eva e o tio Hideyoshi do outro lado de uma porta selada, por meio de uma corrente, ......então é possível para eles até mesmo criar uma fictícia 19ª pessoa através de dispositivos e truques estranhos...?!?!

Se il colpevole è riuscito a rapire il Nonno attraverso la porta sigillata dallo scontrino, se è riuscito a uccidere Eva oba-san e Hideyoshi oji-san dall'altra parte di una porta sigillata da una catena... allora per lui è possibile persino creare l'illusione di una diciannovesima persona con strani trucchi e congegni...?!?!

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi

PC Japanese (JP): 「真里亞ちゃん、それ以上しげしげと見てはなりません。さぁ戦人くんも。嘉音の容態も気になりますし、いつまでもこのようなところにはいられません。戻りましょう。」

Turkish (TR): Bu gerçekten 19. kişi miydi, yoksa ona aksini söylemesini söyleyen 18 kişiden biri miydi?

Steam (ST): All that's certain...is that Maria has been with the rest of us constantly, has always had an alibi, and hasn't done anything suspicious.
Umineko Project (UP): All that's certain is that Maria has been with the rest of us constantly, has always had an alibi, and hasn't done anything that would put her under suspicion.

Steam (ST): That's right, I wonder what's written in the letter we picked up in Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi's room... Aunt Natsuhi should still have it with her...
Umineko Project (UP): That's right, I wonder what's written in the letter we picked up in Auntie Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi's room... Aunt Natsuhi should still have it with her...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's right, I wonder what's written in the letter we picked up in Eva oba-san and Hideyoshi oji-san's room... Natsuhi oba-san should still have it with her...
PC Japanese (JP): そうだ。絵羽伯母さんたちの部屋で拾った手紙は、中に何と書かれているのだろう…。夏妃伯母さんがまだ持っているはず…。
Russian (RU): Кстати, интересно, что написано в том письме, которое мы подобрали в комнате тёти Евы и дяди Хидэёши... Оно всё ещё должно быть у тёти Нацухи...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso mesmo, eu me pergunto o que estava escrito naquela carta que pegamos no quarto da tia Eva e do tio Hideyoshi... A tia Natsuhi ainda deve ter a carta com ela...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對了。在繪羽姑母他們的房間裡撿到的信中，到底寫了些什麼呢…？夏妃伯母應該還把它帶在身邊…。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Giusto, mi domando cosa ci fosse scritto nella lettera che abbiamo preso dalla stanza di Eva oba-san e Hideyoshi oji-san... Natsuhi oba-san dovrebbe averla ancora con sé...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Già. Chissà cosa c'era scritto nella lettera che avevamo raccolto nella stanza di zia Eva e di zio Hideyoshi... Zia Natsuhi doveva averla ancora con sé...
